verses.verse: Then Jesus spoke to the crowd and to his disciples,
saying, "The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat.
"Therefore everything whatever they ask you to observe, observe and do but don't do like they do, for they talk [it] but don't do [it].
"For they tie heavy and grievous burdens and put them on people's shoulders, but they [themselves] will not remove them with one of their fingers.
"But they do all their deeds only to be noticed by people. They make their phylacteries wide and make the borders of their garments very large.
"They love the pre-eminent places at dinners and the seats of the greatest honor in the synagogues.
"They love greeting in the markets and to be addressed by people, "Rabbi, Rabbi."
"But you are not to be addressed as Rabbi, because one is your Master, Christ, and you are all brothers.
"Do not address anyone as your "Father" on this earth, because one is your Father, who is in heaven.
"Also do not be addressed as "Master", because one is your Master, Christ.
"Instead he who is greatest among you will be your servant.
"And whoever will exalt himself will be humbled, but he who will be humble will be exalted.
"But woe to you Scribes and Pharisees. You hypocrites! You close the Kingdom of Heaven from people, for you do not go in yourselves nor allow those who are trying to enter in.
"Woe to you Scribes and Pharisees. You hypocrites! You eat up widows' houses and for pretense make long prayers. Therefore, you will receive the greater damnation.
"Woe to you Scribes and Pharisees. You hypocrites! You travel sea and land to make one convert, and when this is accomplished, you make him twice the child of hell than yourselves.
"Woe to you, you blind guides. You say, «Whoever swears by the temple, it is nothing, but whoever swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.»
"You fools and blind men, for what is greater the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?
"And [you say], «Whoever will swear by the altar, it is nothing, but whoever swears by the gift that is on the altar, he is obligated.
"You fools and blind men, for which is greater, the gift or the altar which sanctifies the gift?
"Therefore whoever will swear by the altar, swears by it and everything on it.
"Whoever will swear by the temple, swears by it and by him who lives there.
"He who will swear by heaven, swears by the throne of God and by him who sits on it.

"Woe to you Scribes and Pharisees. You hypocrites! For you tithe mint, anise, and cumin, yet have omitted the weightier matters of The Law--justice, mercy, and faith. These ought to be done by you and not to leave the other undone.
"You blind guides, who strain at a gnat, yet swallow a camel.
"Woe to you Scribes and Pharisees. You hypocrites! For you clean the cup's and dish's outside, yet inside they are full of extortion and lack of self-control.
"You blind Pharisee. Clean what is inside the cup and dish first, so that the outside may be also clean.
"Woe to you Scribes and Pharisees. You hypocrites! For you are like whitened tombs, which truly appear beautiful outwardly but inside full of dead [men's] bones and all uncleanness.
"Even so you also appear righteous outwardly to people, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.
"Woe to you Scribes and Pharisees? You hypocrites! For you build the prophets tombs and decorate the tombs of the righteous.
"You say, «If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we wouldn't have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.»
"Therefore you are witnesses against yourselves that you are the children of those who killed the prophets.
"Fill up then the measuring cup of your fathers.
"You serpents, you generation of vipers; how can you escape the damnation of hell?
"Therefore, look, I send to you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify. Some of them you will whip in your synagogues and persecute them from city to city.
"So that on you will fall all the righteous blood shed on the earth from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah, the son of Barachias, whom you killed between the temple and the altar.
"Truly I say to you: All these things will come on this generation.

"O Jerusalem, Jerusalem who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you. How often I wanted to gather your children together even like a hen gathers her chicks under [her] wings, but you would not.
"Look, your house is left to you desolate.
"For I say to you: You will not see me anymore, until you say, «Blessed [is] he who comes in the name of the Lord.»
